info.game_comments:
2003 Tournament of Champions quarterfinal game 5.

(Donny Osmond: Today the Jeopardy Clue Crew invades another game show. Can you guess which one?)

(1, 1).clue: Her mother Mary Wollstonecraft was also an accomplished author

(2, 1).clue: It's funeral home sweet home for the Fishers on this HBO series

(3, 1).clue: For many years cover girl Macpherson graced the pages of this magazine which shares her name

(4, 1).clue: In the 1880's these recent inventions sometimes bore signs saying, "Do not attempt to light with a match"

(5, 1).clue: It's the potent potable in a traditional mint julep

(6, 1).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew gives all the clues in this category, while Jimmy receives.)I.M. Pei,Maya Lin,Le Corbusier

(1, 2).clue: Minnie Schoenberg was mom to these famous boys & even performed with them for awhile

(2, 2).clue: The title mom & daughter of this WB show live in the idyllic Connecticut town of Stars Hollow

(3, 2).clue: Called BHG for short, it's big on accents, accessories & landscaping

(4, 2).clue: In 1900 only about 1 U.S. home in 13 had this device granted patent No. 174,465 24 years earlier

(5, 2).clue: Mumm is the word & it's also a brand of this that's been around since 1827

(1, 3).clue: Though she bore Henry VIII 6 children, only 1, Mary I, survived infancy

(2, 3).clue: Richard Moll was a regular as Bull the bald bailiff on this '80s show

(3, 3).clue: American Turf Monthly has been following & promoting this sport since 1946

(4, 3).clue: George Clemens prevented untold chafing when he invented this device found in restaurant bathrooms

(5, 3).clue: "It's another" one of these orange juice cocktails that's mentioned in the title of an Eagles hit

(1, 4).clue: In the Bible there was a heck of a generation gap between her & her son Isaac; she was 91 when she bore him

(2, 4).clue: He plays Monk, the obsessive compulsive detective

(3, 4).clue: "Natural Healing", "Food & Nutrition" & "Fitness" are regular features of this leading health magazine founded in 1950

(4, 4).clue: Robert Watson-Watt's development of this use for radio waves in 1935 helped win the Battle of Britain

(5, 4).clue: At Trafalgar Horatio Nelson's body was preserved in a cask of this, probably not the Napoleon kind

(1, 5).clue: In mythology her daughter Persephone was carried off by Hades

(2, 5).clue: This TV angel was born in Derry City, Northern Ireland

(3, 5).clue: It's Johnson Publishing Co.'s pocket-size weekly with an African-American perspective

(4, 5).clue: A British inventor gave his name tot his type of road surface that spread across Europe in the 19th century

(5, 5).clue: This premium hazelnut liqueur from Italy is made from a 300-year-old recipe

(1, 1).clue: It wasn't "The Plague" that killed this French author but, sadly, a 1960 car accident

(2, 1).clue: This musical based on a 1933 film is currently tapping away on the NYC thoroughfare of the same name

(3, 1).clue: Ironically, President Johnson opposed the 14th Amendment but this state was the first former Confederate state to pass it

(4, 1).clue: This type of multiple birth occurs about once every 7,700 births

(5, 1).clue: The French national anthem was named for its popularity with volunteer army units from this seaport

(6, 1).clue: This term for a fake comes from someone who has only 4 cards of the same suit in poker

(1, 2).clue: His "Siddhartha" was inspired by a trip he made to Asia in 1911

(2, 2).clue: Tony Curtis took the Joe E. Brown role, not the Tony Curtis part, in a new musical based on this Billy Wilder film

(3, 2).clue: Andrew Johnson's impeachment was a result of his attempt to fire this Secretary of War

(4, 2).clue: Jimmy Carter became one of these Aug. 7, 1975 & signed a bill creating a day for them in 1978

(5, 2).clue: A plaid fabric is made from this Indian seaport

(6, 2).clue: To be extremely nervous or agitated is to be like this title of a Tennessee Williams play
(6, 2).correct response: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

(1, 3).clue: A tower at Sandycove, in County Dublin, houses a museum honoring this author

(2, 3).clue: You could say John C. Reilly butchered the role in the 2002 musical based on this Ernest Borgnine film

(3, 3).clue: Created in 1866 it's name evolved from the Greek word for "circle"

(4, 3).clue: In birth order these, like Bill Gates & Catherine Zeta-Jones, are noted for their independence

(5, 3).clue: The 4 largest islands of Spain's Balearic Group are Ibiza, Minorca, Formentera & this one

(6, 3).clue: Meaning the whole of something, this phrase comes from the 3 main parts of a gun

(1, 4).clue: Published in 1969, "Setting Free the Bears" was the first novel by this author

(2, 4).clue: It had to happen: this 1962 classic in which Bette Davis tormented Joan Crawford became a musical in 2002

(3, 4).clue: Reconstruction ended when this President removed the last of the Federal troops from Louisiana on April 24, 1877

(4, 4).clue: "Of unknown origin" is Debra Levi Holtz' memoir of her search for Helen Dunne, this woman

(5, 4).clue: (Hi. I'm Jeff Probst.) Off Thailand's southwest coast Tarutao National Park is in this strait, leading out to the Indian Ocean

(6, 4).clue: To do this is to make an irrevocable decision, like the action that touched off the Roman Civil War

(1, 5).clue: Lula Carson Smith was the original name of this "Reflections in a Golden Eye" author

(2, 5).clue: "Illya Darling" was based on this foreign film about a woman who worked only Monday through Saturday

(3, 5).clue: This bureau, among others, built over 4,000 schools for African-Americans, including Howard University

(4, 5).clue: 4-word phrase for your relationship to your father's brother's son's daughter

(5, 5).clue: (Alex gives the clue from Africa.) An early morning balloon ride for all of us here in Kenya has taken us along this very important river

(6, 5).clue: An old Scottish prayer ask for deliverance from ghoulies, ghosties, long-leggedy beasties & these
(6, 5).correct response: things that go bump in the night

(0, 0).clue: Emperor Constantine commissioned several of these buildings, named from the Greek for "royal house"
